intro: Xiphochaeta, commonly known as the silky mistflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Australia and comprises several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees. The plants are characterized by their showy, fluffy flowers that resemble clouds, typically in shades of white or pink. Xiphochaeta species often have hairy stems and leaves, and they are adapted to grow in a variety of soil types. These plants are popular in gardens for their ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
